time_of_day.High Noon: under the harsh high noon sun

color_grading.Day for Night: using day for night color grading
color_grading.HDR: with high dynamic range color grading

lighting.Backlight: with light source behind the subject, creating a halo effect
lighting.Beauty Dish: with flattering, wraparound light for portraits
lighting.Blue Hour: utilizing cool, diffused light after sunset
lighting.Bounce Flash: with flash bounced off surfaces for softer light
lighting.Broad Lighting: with light on the side of the face toward the camera
lighting.Butterfly Lighting: with light above and in front, casting a nose shadow
lighting.Candlelight: using warm, flickering light from candles
lighting.Clamshell Lighting: using two lights, one above and one below the subject
lighting.Gel Lighting: using colored gels on lights for creative effects
lighting.Gobo Lighting: projecting patterns or shapes onto the subject
lighting.Golden Hour: with warm, golden sunlight just before sunset
lighting.High-Key Lighting: using bright, even lighting for a clean, airy look
lighting.Light Painting: creating unique effects with moving lights in long exposures
lighting.Loop Lighting: creating a small shadow loop on the side of the nose
lighting.Low-Key Lighting: creating a dark, moody atmosphere with minimal light
lighting.Overcast: using soft, diffused light on a cloudy day
lighting.Practical Lighting: incorporating visible light sources within the scene
lighting.Rembrandt Lighting: creating a triangle of light on the cheek
lighting.Rim Light: using light to outline the edges of the subject
lighting.Ring Light: utilizing circular light for even, shadowless illumination
lighting.Short Lighting: illuminating the side of the face away from the camera
lighting.Silhouette: creating a dark subject against a bright background
lighting.Soft Box: using diffused, even light from a soft box
lighting.Split Lighting: illuminating half of the face dramatically
lighting.Spotlight: with a focused beam of light on the subject
lighting.Three-Point Lighting: with key, fill, and back lights for balanced illumination
lighting.Umbrella Lighting: with soft, bounced light from an umbrella
lighting.Window Light: utilizing directional light from a window
